terms.definition: Software as a Service - a cloud-based software delivery model where applications are hosted by a vendor and accessed via the internet
A centralized repository of information, documentation, and resources that provides answers to common questions and solutions to problems
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code over time, allowing users to see revision history and revert to previous versions
A chronological record of all changes, access, and activities performed on documents or systems, providing accountability and transparency
A unified system where all data, documents, and tools are stored and managed in one location, eliminating the need for multiple separate systems
Groups of people with different functional expertise working together toward a common goal, such as engineers, project managers, and specialists
The process of creating, organizing, storing, and maintaining documents in a systematic way to ensure easy access and compliance
The process of ensuring that business practices and documentation adhere to relevant laws, regulations, and industry standards
Key Performance Indicators - measurable values that demonstrate how effectively an organization is achieving key business objectives
Information that is processed and made available immediately as it is collected, without delay or batch processing
A defined sequence of tasks, processes, or steps that need to be completed to achieve a specific business outcome
The network of organizations, people, activities, and resources involved in creating and delivering a product from supplier to customer
A systematic process of evaluating the potential environmental effects of a proposed project or development before it is carried out
The complete sequence of stages that a product, project, or process goes through from initial conception to final disposal or completion
The practice of storing all organizational documents and information in a single, unified location or system for easy access and management
